alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:23AM CDT until May 06 at 10:33AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Fall River at Fredonia affecting Wilson County. For the Fall River...including Fredonia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fall River at Fredonia. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flood waters begin to encroach on residential homes and floods half of yards along the south bank of river located 1 mile south of Fredonia off of Highway 96. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:01 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Fall River Fredonia 17.0 24.5 Thu 8 am CDT 7.9 6.1 6.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
